KH.content: one telling to the next, author gets farther & farther away: mythic saying resembles a discourse w/out a legitimate father, orphan, bastard, distinguished from philosophy, in Phaedrus, which must have a father to answer for it
KH.linkedContent: one telling to the next, author gets farther & farther away: mythic saying resembles a discourse w/out a legitimate father, orphan, bastard, distinguished from philosophy, in Phaedrus, which must have a father to answer for it

BL.content: Derrida concedes presuppositions, conventions [on authorship of text], while exposing them
BL.linkedContent: Derrida concedes presuppositions, conventions [on authorship of text], while exposing them

BL.content: different periods of history of positive law give substance to literature, value of signatures [“authors”]
BL.linkedContent: different periods of history of positive law give substance to literature, value of signatures [“authors”]

LOBL.content: legal bindings, framings, of Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort into single book by single author
LOBL.linkedContent: legal bindings, framings, of Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort into single book by single author

LOBL.content: Derrida’s mad hypothesis, nothing to do w/ intention of “author” that the hymen btwn the 2 women in L’arrêt de mort (separated by uncrossable glass partition of 2 stories) is the absolute terror, that they love and approach each other w/out the narrator
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida’s mad hypothesis, nothing to do w/ intention of “author” that the hymen btwn the 2 women in L’arrêt de mort (separated by uncrossable glass partition of 2 stories) is the absolute terror, that they love and approach each other w/out the narrator

SPOM.content: one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime of its very author
SPOM.linkedContent: one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime of its very author

POOF.content: sage & fool: l'un est l’autre, l'un garde et se garde de l’autre, l'un se fait violence, encore la surenchère infinie > this raising of the stakes doesn’t need an author’s intention
POOF.linkedContent: sage & fool: l'un est l’autre, l'un garde et se garde de l’autre, l'un se fait violence, encore la surenchère infinie > this raising of the stakes doesn’t need an author’s intention

PP.content: systematic chain of pharmakon not simply intentions of an author going by name Plato
PP.linkedContent: systematic chain of pharmakon not simply intentions of an author going by name Plato

FSW.content: if there were only perception, pure permeability of breaching, there would be no breaches (frayages), no legible writing, but pure perception does not exist: nous ne sommes écrits qu’en écrivants > subject of writing does not exist as sovereign solitude of author
FSW.linkedContent: if there were only perception, pure permeability of breaching, there would be no breaches (frayages), no legible writing, but pure perception does not exist: nous ne sommes écrits qu’en écrivants > subject of writing does not exist as sovereign solitude of author

FSW.content: we would search public in vain for first reader, i.e. first author of a work
FSW.linkedContent: we would search public in vain for first reader, i.e. first author of a work

DS.content: [on conscious intention of author] does not matter to us here, reader should not know why, burst of laughter deep inside antre answers these questions
DS.linkedContent: [on conscious intention of author] does not matter to us here, reader should not know why, burst of laughter deep inside antre answers these questions

POS.content: double, interval, biphase, biface, bifurcated writing can only be marked in a grouped textual field, not in a punctual position, not w/ a single author
POS.linkedContent: double, interval, biphase, biface, bifurcated writing can only be marked in a grouped textual field, not in a punctual position, not w/ a single author

ROP.content: to identify someone w/ what they get paid for is not to read
ROP.linkedContent: to identify someone w/ what they get paid for is not to read

OTO.content: borderline btwn “work” & “life”: dynamis, virtual & mobile potency, neither active nor passive, outside nor inside, not a thin line, traverses 2 bodies (corpus & body) > not an indivisible trait lying btwn enclosure of philosophemes & life of author identifiable behind name
OTO.linkedContent: borderline btwn “work” & “life”: dynamis, virtual & mobile potency, neither active nor passive, outside nor inside, not a thin line, traverses 2 bodies (corpus & body) > not an indivisible trait lying btwn enclosure of philosophemes & life of author identifiable behind name

PS.content: Artaud wants to renounce: superstition of the text, dictatorship of the writer
PS.linkedContent: Artaud wants to renounce: superstition of the text, dictatorship of the writer

FS.content: [for deconstruction] history of the work is not only its past, it is the impossibility of the text ever being present > legitimating intention keeps to internal truth, avoids thinking a subjective origin that is not simply psychological/mental
FS.linkedContent: [for deconstruction] history of the work is not only its past, it is the impossibility of the text ever being present > legitimating intention keeps to internal truth, avoids thinking a subjective origin that is not simply psychological/mental

O.content: first effect of dissemination: individuality & responsibility no longer predominate
O.linkedContent: first effect of dissemination: individuality & responsibility no longer predominate

O.content: literature is beyond of everything: author would have to disappear along w/ literature
O.linkedContent: literature is beyond of everything: author would have to disappear along w/ literature

DPi.content: exemplarity of Hugolian economy considerably exceeds the singular genius who represents it so well
DPi.linkedContent: exemplarity of Hugolian economy considerably exceeds the singular genius who represents it so well

TB.content: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text
TB.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text

PIO.content: universality (ideal objectivity, unlimited recurrence) in invention blurs signature of invention: name of individual (singular empirical entity) is associated w/ invention in inessential, extrinsic, accidental, aleatory way > this gives rise to enormous problem of property rights
PIO.linkedContent: universality (ideal objectivity, unlimited recurrence) in invention blurs signature of invention: name of individual (singular empirical entity) is associated w/ invention in inessential, extrinsic, accidental, aleatory way > this gives rise to enormous problem of property rights

TR.content: de Man: deconstruction of figural dimension threatens autobiographical subject
TR.linkedContent: de Man: deconstruction of figural dimension threatens autobiographical subject

D.content: authorless voice, phonic tracing no ideal signified could stamp [sa frappe sensible] sans reste, all representative outcroppings (affleurements) subjected to rhythm of a numerous pounding
D.linkedContent: authorless voice, phonic tracing no ideal signified could stamp [sa frappe sensible] sans reste, all representative outcroppings (affleurements) subjected to rhythm of a numerous pounding

D.content: Verlaine was told: text speaking of itself, w/out an author
D.linkedContent: Verlaine was told: text speaking of itself, w/out an author

ATM.content: what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?
ATM.linkedContent: what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?

ATM.content: how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”
ATM.linkedContent: how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”

ATM.content: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage
ATM.linkedContent: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage

ATM.content: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre
ATM.linkedContent: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre

ATM.content: Levinas: the other can always dispossess me of my work
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas: the other can always dispossess me of my work

CIN.content: Derrida gives Cinder a proper name, is she the signatory of this text?
CIN.linkedContent: Derrida gives Cinder a proper name, is she the signatory of this text?

CIN.content: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder
CIN.linkedContent: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder

BSi.content: Valéry & Monsieur Teste doubles of marionettes—who makes who speak?
BSi.linkedContent: Valéry & Monsieur Teste doubles of marionettes—who makes who speak?

OG.content: writing can never be thought under the category of the subject
OG.linkedContent: writing can never be thought under the category of the subject

OG.content: Derrida is not concerned w/ Sausurre’s intentions, nor the very thought itself, instead interested in a text which has influenced readings, borrowings, etc.
OG.linkedContent: Derrida is not concerned w/ Sausurre’s intentions, nor the very thought itself, instead interested in a text which has influenced readings, borrowings, etc.

OG.content: “Hegel,” “Rousseau,” “Leibniz,” “Descartes” neither identities nor causes > name of problems > so long as closure limits our discourse: we will not have other concepts
OG.linkedContent: “Hegel,” “Rousseau,” “Leibniz,” “Descartes” neither identities nor causes > name of problems > so long as closure limits our discourse: we will not have other concepts

SPEC.content: inscription of a subject in his [Freud’s] text is also condition of the performance/pertinence of a text, beyond empirical subjectivity, supposing that could exist as soon as one writes, substitutes, supplements: notion of truth incapable of accounting for this performance
SPEC.linkedContent: inscription of a subject in his [Freud’s] text is also condition of the performance/pertinence of a text, beyond empirical subjectivity, supposing that could exist as soon as one writes, substitutes, supplements: notion of truth incapable of accounting for this performance

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] speculating, “author” already no longer there, no longer responsible, leaves document in your hands > “literary”: make of it what you will, it’s up to you—you’re more than ever on board
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] speculating, “author” already no longer there, no longer responsible, leaves document in your hands > “literary”: make of it what you will, it’s up to you—you’re more than ever on board

SPEC.content: PP as author or as authority, it/he only increased by dissidents speaking against it
SPEC.linkedContent: PP as author or as authority, it/he only increased by dissidents speaking against it

SPEC.content: PP loses mastery w/ flooding (Überschwemmung), psychic apparatus no longer seeks pleasure, occupied only w/ binding (binden) excitations, w/ “mastering (bewältigen)” them
SPEC.linkedContent: PP loses mastery w/ flooding (Überschwemmung), psychic apparatus no longer seeks pleasure, occupied only w/ binding (binden) excitations, w/ “mastering (bewältigen)” them

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] malignant tumors also “narcissistic,” unleash themselves w/out concern for other cells, for the rights of authors or of succession
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] malignant tumors also “narcissistic,” unleash themselves w/out concern for other cells, for the rights of authors or of succession

FV.content: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]
FV.linkedContent: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]

FV.content: inscriber/inscribing function not to be confused w/ author > Lacan excludes textual fiction, indicates a general narrative w/in neutralized or naturalized frame, thus overlooks the frame
FV.linkedContent: inscriber/inscribing function not to be confused w/ author > Lacan excludes textual fiction, indicates a general narrative w/in neutralized or naturalized frame, thus overlooks the frame

FV.content: structure of fiction reduced when related to its condition of truth, poor formalism which guarantees semantic content, doesn’t account for 1) “scription-fiction” and “scription-fictor” 2) narrating narration & narrator > complicity btwn formalist withdrawal (repli) and hermeneutic semanticism (or psychoanalysis applied to literature) [neglect of the subject-author, which, in some situations, might constitute progress or a legitimate demand]
FV.linkedContent: structure of fiction reduced when related to its condition of truth, poor formalism which guarantees semantic content, doesn’t account for 1) “scription-fiction” and “scription-fictor” 2) narrating narration & narrator > complicity btwn formalist withdrawal (repli) and hermeneutic semanticism (or psychoanalysis applied to literature) [neglect of the subject-author, which, in some situations, might constitute progress or a legitimate demand]
